January 26, IS59
Dr. Kenneth D. Korberg, Program Consultant
Kew Educational Media
Department of Health, Education and Welfare
Office of Education
Washington 25, D. C.
Dear Dr. K or berg:
As the definition becomes clearer regarding which of the projects under
Title VII will be handled on a contract basis, and which on a grant
basis, it appears that all or most of the three proposals we have so
far submitted might possibly fall into the contractual area.
If that is the case, we should like to have our grant application bud¬
gets disregarded in order to enable us to begin anew to conform to the
new approaches and limitations which are beginning to emerge and to
discuss contract possibilities on a wholly new basis when this becomes
desirable. This is not a request for removal of oar grant requests from
the file, of course, until a final decision is made that these functions
will definitely be carried on only on a contract basis.
We should also like to request particularly that, in any contractual
consideration, our statements as contained in our October 24, 1958
proposal and the statement of "The Training Program of the NAEB* *
(copies attached) as sent you earlier be given careful consideration
as succinct, summaries of our credentials, particularly in the research,
clearing house and teacher-training areas. We believe they are essen¬
tial for the information of those who make contractee selections
This letter is prompted by discussions with Mr. Stardahl and others
when I was in Washington for the recent meeting of representatives of
the organisations most concerned with dissemination problems in
connection with the Act, and by the new definitions and clarifications,
now emerging, which we of course did not have at the time these re¬
quests were submitted.
